description:
Tekkaman Blade takes place in the year 2300 AD. On a certain moment, the Radam attack earth. A few months after the beginning of the invasion, a tekkaman appears, he calls himself Blade and with the help of the Space Knights, Blade starts to fight the radam. But there are a few things that Blade isn't telling about his past.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kawasak54965532)

Hiroyuki Kawasaki is a screenwriter and novelist.

[Website](http://www.kaoru-wada.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaoru_wadash) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4zbQfESCpBlXi1XlpnlG95)

He is a Japanese music composer. Married to voice actress [Akiko Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95749/Akiko-Nakagawa).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/298477416)

Oobari began his career when he joined the animation studio Ashi Production, working on titles like [Tokusou Kihei Dorvack](https://anilist.co/anime/5143/) and [Sei Juushi Bismarck](https://anilist.co/anime/2361/). Soon after, at the age of 19, he got his first major break when he landed the role of mecha designer on [Dancouga: Super Beast Machine God](https://anilist.co/anime/2255/). Not too long after, at the young age of 21, he was given his first directorial role by directing episodes 5 and 6 of the [Bubblegum Crisis](https://anilist.co/anime/1347/) OVA series. 

Oobari mainly likes to work within the sci-fi mecha and fighting genres. His designs are easily recognizable from the voluptuous female forms and well-toned pretty boys he tends to create to appeal to wide audiences. For references, he likes to use images of professional wrestlers and models. He is friends with fellow former animator and current freelance illustrator [Tsukasa Kotoboki](https://anilist.co/staff/97965/).

He wasn't originally interested in animation but was inspired by [Satoshi Urushihara](https://anilist.co/staff/98177/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%AD%E3%81%8E%E3%81%97%E3%81%B2%E3%82%8D%E3%81%97)

Hiroshi Negishi is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

__Graduated:__ Toyo University

During school Sawai always aimed to be manga artist. After graduating from Toyo University he joined Tatsunoko Production where he became a storyboard artist and later episode director. He served two more years as a production assistant there until he left and became a freelance episode director. Today he works mainly for Bee Train, whose founder Kouichi Mashimo is a good friend of his.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sekise10) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yutaka_nakamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村豊_(アニメーター%29)

Yutaka Nakamura graduated from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and first joined studio Ad Cosmo. After switching several studios; from Art Office Sharaku, to Anime Torotoro, to [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), he eventually settled at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) with a contract.

Nakamura is considered to be among the best action animators, with his scenes featuring catchy movement and effects. Some of his recognizable traits include camera shaking, blurs, and bending and stretching high-speed objects. His fights are praised for its weighty, intense choreographies that are heavy on impact frames. His signature trait is drawing debris as simple cubes, consequentially named "Yutapon Cubes," which are stylistic and easy to draw. Despite being responsible for popularizing it, Nakamura has stated that he started doing it when he noticed [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) doing it. 

(Source: Animators Wiki)

Ichirou Itano is a Japanese director, producer, animator and mechanical designer. He has worked in a number of science fiction anime series, especially mecha-themed ones. Director of works such as [Angel Cop](https://anilist.co/anime/1351/), [Battle Royal High School](https://anilist.co/anime/3625/), [Gantz](https://anilist.co/anime/384/) and more.

Itano is best known among anime fans for a style of action scene that he developed, usually nicknamed "Itano Circus" by fans; it refers to a highly stylized and acrobatic method of depicting aerial combat and dogfights in many anime.

The production in [Space Runaway Ideon](https://anilist.co/anime/930/) became a hot topic in the anime industry, and it came to be called this by comparing the brisk movement of mechanics to the air acrobatics of the circus. The technique became more famous when Itano used it for the "dogfights" depicted in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) anime TV series in 1982. It's characterized by detailed, fluid shading of the mecha, the close-range acrobatic moves the dueling fighters make in combat, as well as twisting contrails left by fighters and missiles. It is also commonly used in specific reference to an attack where a mecha or spaceship launches a large swarm of guided missiles with meticulously animated spiraling smoke trails and erratic trajectories and its target is repeatedly dodging those missiles at a high speed.

According to him, [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/), [Masami Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/129865/) and [Yasushi Muraki](https://anilist.co/staff/105090/) are the only animators to have fully mastered Itano Circus.

__Birth name:__ Toyoharu Yoshida (吉田豊治)

Brother of [Tatsuo Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/100241/), and [Kenji Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/104807), he co-founded Tatsunoko Productions with his two brothers.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/湖川友謙)

Most known for his work in the '80s with [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

Often goes by one of his many pen-names.

Director who started off as an animator. Still animates on occasions.

Married to [Sayo Aoi](https://anilist.co/staff/118784/).

Director who started off as an animator. Still animates on occasions.

Married to [Sayo Aoi](https://anilist.co/staff/118784/).
Dubbing director at Iyuno Poland who has directed the Polish dubs of many Disney movies and TV shows.
